bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, April 14, 1902
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D MAY 22 DEPT. OF STATE

div1.p: No. 91. Consular, Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, April 14, 1902.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Acknowledged receipt of your No. 41. Consular of March 11, 1902, relating to the whereabouts of J. T. Ander.
No. 91, Consular Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, April 14, 1902
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt April 13, 1902, of your No. 41. Consular of March 11, 1902, with enclosure, by Second Assistant Secretary of State, relative to the wehreabouts of one J. T. Ander, late of Tuscaloose Ala, but more recently of Greenville, Sinoe County Liberia.
I have this day written to Greenville, enquireing after Ander. I have the
the honor to be your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith. Consul General.
